page.title: 08NOTABLE BUILDINGS(2)
page.content: THE LIBRARY The library is in the market place in Camelford.At the top of the stairs there is a display of thousands of books.On top of the library stands the town clock with a camel weather-vane. SIR JAMES SMITH SCHOOL In 1679 land was bought to support the school.Sir James Smith paid money to it hoping he would be made MP.In 1872 Sir James Smith's School was opened. The school was meant for both boys and girls but girls weren't allowed to go until 1905.It was then a boarding school.Children came from Plymouth to go to school.After World War 2 the population in the school rose.A new school was opened and built in 1962. Over 600 children now attend from Crackington Haven down to Port Isaac and inland from Warbstow to St.Breward.Most come in on buses.
